sections.heading: Eligibility – Who Can Open
points: Single Adult
Joint Account (up to 3 adults – Joint A or Joint B type)
Guardian on behalf of a minor or person of unsound mind
Minor above 10 years in their own name

sections.heading: Deposit Rules
points: Minimum Deposit: ₹1,000 (in multiples of ₹1,000)
Maximum Deposit: ₹9 lakh in a single account, ₹15 lakh in a joint account (equally shared)
Cumulative Limit per Individual: Total deposits in all MIS accounts must not exceed ₹9 lakh
Minor Account Limit: Separate from guardian’s individual limit

sections.heading: Interest Details
points: Paid monthly, starting one month after deposit
Unclaimed interest will not earn further interest
Excess deposits refunded; only Post Office Savings Account interest applies for that period
Auto credit into savings account at the same post office or via ECS
Monthly interest from CBS post offices can be credited to any CBS-linked savings account
Interest is taxable in the depositor’s hands

sections.heading: Premature Closure
points: Not allowed before 1 year of account opening
If closed after 1–3 years: 2% of principal is deducted
If closed after 3–5 years: 1% of principal is deducted
Requires submission of prescribed form and passbook

sections.heading: Maturity
points: Maturity after 5 years from the date of opening
Requires form and passbook to close
If account holder dies before maturity: amount paid to nominee/legal heir with interest up to the previous month

sections.heading: Note
points: Governed by National Savings (MIS) Account Rules, 2019
